intro: Hippocrepis scabra f. baetica, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant features a hairy, branched stem and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to Mediterranean climates with low moisture availability.
